intro: Pedicularis conifera, commonly known as the coniferous lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Its leaves are often reduced to scales, and it has a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi. Pedicularis conifera typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils.
